docs.title: drone-tui
docs.text: drone-tui (drone-interactive) is a terminal user interface for Drone CI. Browse repositories, inspect builds, and read step logs — all from your terminal.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Browse all your Drone CI repositories with fuzzy search
  • View build history with status indicators
  • Read build logs with tabbed step navigation
  • Full ANSI color support in log output
  • Keyboard-driven navigation

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
export DRONE_SERVER=https://drone.example.com
export DRONE_TOKEN=your-api-token
drone-tui

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text: Key Action enter Select / drill down esc Go back / Filter list tab / shift+tab Switch log tabs q / ctrl+c Quit

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on Keep a Changelog, and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.

docs.title: Added
docs.text: • Vim-style gx keybinding to open current repo/build/step in browser

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text: • Corrected curl flags in installation docs

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Start in filter mode by default on repo list screen
  • Vim navigation bindings (gg/G) for jumping to top/bottom in all views
  • Breadcrumb statusbar showing current repo and build context
  • Mouse support for clicking repos/builds and scrolling logs
  • Toggle to show/hide inactive repos with 'a' key
  • Double-escape to quit from repo list
  • Select first build by default when viewing build list

docs.title: Changed
docs.text:
• Simplified log tab bar to single-line integrated with statusbar
  • Removed spacing between build title and metadata for clearer grouping
  • Removed extra newlines between log lines for cleaner display
  • Hide inactive repos by default (toggle with 'a' to show all)

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Interactive TUI for browsing Drone CI repos, builds, and logs
  • Repo list with fuzzy search
  • Build list with fuzzy search and status indicators
  • Log viewer with tabbed step navigation and ANSI color support
  • Keyboard-driven navigation (enter to drill down, esc to go back)
  • Cross-platform binaries (Linux, macOS, Windows)
  • MkDocs documentation site

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: drone-tui is configured through environment variables.

docs.title: Required Variables
docs.text: Variable Description DRONE_SERVER URL of your Drone CI server (e.g., https://drone.example.com) DRONE_TOKEN Your Drone API token

docs.title: Getting Your Token
docs.text:
1. Log into your Drone CI instance
  2. Navigate to your account settings
  3. Copy the API token shown on the page

docs.title: Shell Configuration
docs.text:
Add to your shell profile (~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc, etc.):

export DRONE_SERVER=https://drone.example.com
export DRONE_TOKEN=your-api-token

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository:

    git clone https://github.com/arch-err/drone-tui.git
cd drone-tui

  2. Install dependencies:

    go mod download

  3. Build:

    go build ./cmd/drone-tui

  4. Run:

    export DRONE_SERVER=https://drone.example.com
export DRONE_TOKEN=your-token
./drone-tui

docs.title: Binary Releases
docs.text:
Download the latest binary from the releases page.

Linux (amd64)macOS (Apple Silicon) 
curl -LO https://github.com/arch-err/drone-tui/releases/latest/download/drone-tui_linux_amd64.tar.gz
tar xzf drone-tui_linux_amd64.tar.gz
sudo mv drone-tui /usr/local/bin/

curl -LO https://github.com/arch-err/drone-tui/releases/latest/download/drone-tui_darwin_arm64.tar.gz
tar xzf drone-tui_darwin_arm64.tar.gz
sudo mv drone-tui /usr/local/bin/

docs.title: From Source
docs.text:
Requires Go 1.21+:

go install github.com/arch-err/drone-tui/cmd/drone-tui@latest

docs.title: Starting drone-tui
docs.text:
drone-tui

This launches the interactive TUI. You'll see a list of all repositories synced with your Drone CI instance.

docs.title: Navigation Flow
docs.text: Repositories → Builds → Log Viewer

docs.title: Repository List
docs.text:
• Scroll through repositories with arrow keys or j/k
  • Press / to fuzzy search by repository name
  • Press enter to view builds for the selected repository

docs.title: Build List
docs.text:
• Browse builds with status indicators, event type, branch, and author
  • Press / to filter builds
  • Press enter to view build logs
  • Press esc to go back to repositories

docs.title: Log Viewer
docs.text:
• Logs are displayed in a tabbed interface with one tab per build step
  • Use tab and shift+tab to switch between steps
  • Scroll with arrow keys, pgup/pgdn, or home/end
  • ANSI colors from build output are preserved
  • Press esc to go back to the build list
